alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 8:02PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Maine, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This combined with heavy rainfall from earlier this afternoon will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackman, Seboomook, Soldiertown, Brassua, Town Of Thorndike, Alder Brook, Pittston Academy Grant, Hammond, Long Pond and Tomhegan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
